params.hints: The SELECT statement has no WHERE clause and could examine many more rows than intended

Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table
LIMIT without ORDER BY causes non-deterministic results, depending on the query execution plan

statements.sql:
SELECT * from messages where id in (
SELECT MAX(id) AS id
FROM messages
WHERE msg_to ='1' OR msg_from ='1'
GROUP BY (IF(msg_to ='1', msg_from, msg_to)))

params.hints: Use SELECT * only if you need all columns from table

statements.sql:
UPDATE users SET newmessagesCount='0
' WHERE id='1'
SELECT id,username,avatar_url FROM users WHERE id <> '1'
